Sentencas: A highly efficient integrated energy conversion system is built based on a methane catalytic decomposition reactor (MCDR) together with a direct carbon fuel cell (DCFC) and an internal reforming solid oxide fuel cell (IRSOFC).
Titulo: High efficiency chemical energy conversion system based on a methane catalytic decomposition reaction and two fuel cells: Part I. Process modeling and validation

Sentencas: In the MCDR, methane is decomposed to pure carbon and hydrogen.
Titulo: High efficiency chemical energy conversion system based on a methane catalytic decomposition reaction and two fuel cells: Part I. Process modeling and validation

Sentencas: Carbon is used as the fuel of DCFC to generate power and produce pure carbon dioxide.
Titulo: High efficiency chemical energy conversion system based on a methane catalytic decomposition reaction and two fuel cells: Part I. Process modeling and validation

Sentencas: The hydrogen and unconverted methane are used as the fuel in the IRSOFC.
Titulo: High efficiency chemical energy conversion system based on a methane catalytic decomposition reaction and two fuel cells: Part I. Process modeling and validation

Sentencas: A gas turbine cycle is also used to produce more power output from the thermal energy generated in the IRSOFC.
Titulo: High efficiency chemical energy conversion system based on a methane catalytic decomposition reaction and two fuel cells: Part I. Process modeling and validation

Sentencas: The output performance and efficiency of both the DCFC and IRSOFC are investigated and compared by development of exact models of them.
Titulo: High efficiency chemical energy conversion system based on a methane catalytic decomposition reaction and two fuel cells: Part I. Process modeling and validation

Sentencas: It is found that this system has a unique loading flexibility due to the good high-loading property of DCFC and the good low loading property of IRSOFC.
Titulo: High efficiency chemical energy conversion system based on a methane catalytic decomposition reaction and two fuel cells: Part I. Process modeling and validation

Sentencas: The effects of temperature, pressure, current densities, and methane conversion on the performance of the fuel cells and the system are discussed.
Titulo: High efficiency chemical energy conversion system based on a methane catalytic decomposition reaction and two fuel cells: Part I. Process modeling and validation

Sentencas: The CO2 emission reduction is effective, up to 80%, can be reduced with the proposed system.
Titulo: High efficiency chemical energy conversion system based on a methane catalytic decomposition reaction and two fuel cells: Part I. Process modeling and validation
